column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Ultimately , the website 's purpose was to shine a light on Glenn Beck 's style , and to reflect it right back at him .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) How did you feel when you first found out that Glenn Beck had begun to take legal actions with regard to your website ?
#Text=E-H : Well , it certainly did n't make me very happy , but at the same time , it confirmed what I suspected .
#Text=It did n't make me happy because , obviously , nobody likes to be sued .
#Text=It also made me unhappy because I saw it as a direct assault on free speech .
#Text=Of course , it confirmed my suspicions that Glenn Beck 's claims to be a champion of the constitution are false claims .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Why did you register alternate domain names : " DidGlennBeckRapeAndMurderAYoungGirlIn1990.com " , and " gb1990.com " ? Will you maintain the website at those locations ?
#Text=E-H : As I said about the original domain - I wanted to register the meme as the domain , and that 's what I referred to as the " statement " domain .

column1: #Text=The " question " domain came about because the entire concept of the meme is not to try and convince people that Beck raped and murdered ; but how the supposed rumour that he did is a direct parody of the techniques he himself uses .

column3:
place[56]	giv[56]	_	_
9-3	971-979	question	abstract|place[56]	new|giv[56]	coref	10-5
9-4	980-981

column1: #Text=I thought that the question form would serve the meme better , so I went ahead and registered it ; and as soon as I did , I changed the website to the question instead of the statement ( in the title and header for the page ) .
#Text=When the domain dispute was filed , I registered gb1990.com , as well as gb1990.net .
#Text=I did this partly because if he managed to get the question or statement domains taken down , I would have a backup in place .
#Text=Also , it 's a lot easier to type " gb1990 " than either of the long versions , so that was a part of it as well .
#Text=I made gb1990.com the primary domain for the website , and parked the other two on top .
#Text=I put gb1990.net as a mirror on my second server , in case something happened to the first .

#Text=( ( WN ) ) You wrote in your November 6 letter to Beck , " It bears observing that by bringing the WIPO complaint , you took what was merely one small critique meme , in a sea of internet memes , and turned it into a super meme . " Media commentators have written that Beck 's actions in the case trigged the " Streisand effect " . Do you think this happened here ? What do you mean when you say Beck created a " super meme " ?

column3:

column1: #Text=E-H :
#Text=I definitely think the Streisand effect came into play .
#Text=Even before I got the website up and running , Farkers had already spread the meme - asking questions on Yahoo Answers , for example .
#Text=So it definitely got attention out there ; but the traffic to the site dropped off drastically after the first couple of days .
#Text=It was n't until people posted news about the legal threats to Reddit , Fark , Digg , and many blogs that I saw spikes in traffic .
#Text=The major spikes in traffic to the site have all come from updates about where the legal fight stood .
#Text=For example , when a thread went green ( public ) on Fark.com , traffic to my servers nearly overwhelmed them for a couple of hours .
#Text=When we posted my brilliant lawyer Marc Randazza 's responses to the original WIPO complaint , traffic was high for a couple of days .
#Text=In each case , it dropped down to a relatively low level when news was sparse .
